rawKJV: And God said unto Moses, I AM THAT I AM: and he said, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, I AM hath sent me unto you.
grebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלֹהִים אֶל־מֹשֶׁה <H>אֶֽהְיֶה</H> אֲשֶׁר <H>אֶֽהְיֶה</H> וַיֹּאמֶר כֹּה תֹאמַר לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל <H>אֶֽהְיֶה</H> שְׁלָחַנִי אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃

rawFirstEdition:
Kah God wonk unnau Mosesoh, yeu pish kuttinnóneau wunnaumonuh Israel, Jehovah «Ummanittꝏ̄mooh» kꝏ̄shuóog, Ummanittꝏ̄moh Abraham, Ummanittꝏ̄moh Isaak, Ummanittꝏ̄moh Jakob nuttannꝏ̄nuk en kuhhogkaóont, yeu micheme «Nꝏ̄weseuonk», kah yeu nꝏ̄che mehquoantamun en pometuonganehtu ‹pometuonganéhtu.
›

rawKJV: And God said moreover unto Moses, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, the LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath sent me unto you: this is my name for ever, and this is my memorial unto all generations.
grebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר עוֹד אֱלֹהִים אֶל־מֹשֶׁה כֹּֽה־תֹאמַר אֶל־בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי אֲבֹתֵיכֶם אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם אֱלֹהֵי יִצְחָק וֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב שְׁלָחַנִי אֲלֵיכֶם זֶה־שְּׁמִי לְעֹלָם וְזֶה זִכְרִי לְדֹר דֹּֽר׃

rawFirstEdition: Monchish, ‹môin› nananuácheg Israel, kah us nagoh, Jehovah Ummanittꝏ̄mꝏ̄oh wutꝏ̄shinneóg ‹nunnaeíhtunk›, Ummanittꝏ̄moh Abaraham Isaak, kah Jakob, nꝏ̄wau, «nátáwáhuwae» «kenátáuwáhunnúmwop», kah ne ‹ánhénóg› ut Egypt.
rawSecondEdition: Monchish, moin nananuácheg Israel, kah us nagoh, Jehovah um Manittꝏ̄mꝏ̄oh wutꝏ̄shinneóg ‹nunnaeihtunk›, um-Manittꝏ̄moh Abraham, Isaak, kah Jakob, nꝏ̄wau, ‹natauwáhuwae› «kenátauwáhennúmwop», kah ne ánhenóg ut Egypt.
comparedFirstEdition: Monchish, ‹môin› nananuácheg Israel, kah us nagoh, Jehovah Ummanittꝏ̄mꝏ̄oh wutꝏ̄shinneóg ‹nunnaeíhtunk›, Ummanittꝏ̄moh Abaraham Isaak, kah Jakob, nꝏ̄wau, «nátáwáhuwae» «kenátáuwáhunnúmwop», kah ne ‹ánhénóg› ut Egypt.

rawKJV: Go, and gather the elders of Israel together, and say unto them, The LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, appeared unto me, saying, I have surely visited you, and seen that which is done to you in Egypt:
grebrew: לֵךְ וְאָֽסַפְתָּ אֶת־זִקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵהֶם יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי אֲבֹֽתֵיכֶם נִרְאָה אֵלַי אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב לֵאמֹר פָּקֹד פָּקַדְתִּי אֶתְכֶם וְאֶת־הֶעָשׂוּי לָכֶם בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃

rawFirstEdition: Kah nussip, «kussóhhꝏ̄wunnunnumwꝏ̄» wutch «ónkquanuminneàt» ut Egypt, en wutohkit Cananite, kah Hittite, kah Amorite, kah Perisite, kah Hivite, kah Jebusite, ohkit «adtomógkog» sogkodtunk, kah honey.

rawKJV: And I have said, I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt unto the land of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, unto «a» land flowing with milk and honey.
grebrew: וָאֹמַר אַעֲלֶה אֶתְכֶם מֵעֳנִי מִצְרַיִם אֶל־אֶרֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי וְהַחִתִּי וְהָֽאֱמֹרִי וְהַפְּרִזִּי וְהַחִוִּי וְהַיְבוּסִי אֶל־אֶרֶץ זָבַת חָלָב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃

rawFirstEdition: Kah nag pish kꝏ̄namptunkquog; kah pish kuppeyam, kah nanánuwácheg Israel ketassꝏ̄tamwut ut Egypt, kah pish kuttinau, Jehovah Ummanittꝏ̄moh Hebrews nunnogskunkqun, kah yeuyeu «moncheáhhinnean», «kꝏ̄weehquetúmauúnumun», nishikqunne pomushónat en touohkomukqut, onk woh nussephámauómun, Nummanittꝏ̄mun God.

rawKJV: And they shall hearken to thy voice: and thou shalt come, thou and the elders of Israel, unto the king of Egypt, and ye shall say unto him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath met with us: and now let us go, we beseech thee, three days' journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.
grebrew: וְשָׁמְעוּ לְקֹלֶךָ וּבָאתָ אַתָּה וְזִקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶל־מֶלֶךְ מִצְרַיִם וַאֲמַרְתֶּם אֵלָיו יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי הָֽעִבְרִיִּים נִקְרָה עָלֵינוּ וְעַתָּה נֵֽלֲכָה־נָּא דֶּרֶךְ שְׁלֹשֶׁת יָמִים בַּמִּדְבָּר וְנִזְבְּחָה לַֽיהוָה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃

rawKJV: And I will give this people favour in the sight of the Egyptians: and it shall come to pass, that, when ye go, ye shall «not» go empty.

rawKJV: Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread; even the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses: for whosoever eateth leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.

rawKJV: And in the first day there shall be an holy convocation, and in the seventh day there shall be an holy convocation to you; no manner of work shall be done in them, save that which every man must eat, that only may be done of you.

rawKJV: And ye shall observe the feast of unleavened bread; for in this selfsame day have I brought your armies out of the land of Egypt: therefore shall ye observe this day in your generations by an ordinance for ever.

rawKJV: But the seventh day is the sabbath of the LORD thy God: in it thou shalt «not» do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy manservant, nor thy maidservant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates:
grebrew: וְיוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי שַׁבָּת ׀ לַיהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ לֹֽא־תַעֲשֶׂה כָל־מְלָאכָה אַתָּה ׀ וּבִנְךָֽ־וּבִתֶּךָ עַבְדְּךָ וַאֲמָֽתְךָ וּבְהֶמְתֶּךָ וְגֵרְךָ אֲשֶׁר בִּשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃

rawFirstEdition:
Newutche nequtta «tahshikquinut» Jehovah wutayimun kesuk, kah ohke, keihtoh kah wame ne noh ohtag: kah anwohsin nesausuk audtahshikquinogok, newutche Jehovah ‹wuñantamun› nesausuk audtahshikquinogok, kah «ꝏ̄netupantamwohteauun.
»

»

rawKJV: And thou shalt speak unto all that are wise hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they may make Aaron's garments to consecrate him, that he may minister unto me in the priest's office.
grebrew: וְאַתָּה תְּדַבֵּר אֶל־כָּל־חַכְמֵי־לֵב אֲשֶׁר מִלֵּאתִיו רוּחַ חָכְמָה וְעָשׂוּ אֶת־בִּגְדֵי אַהֲרֹן לְקַדְּשׁוֹ לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִֽי׃

rawFirstEdition:

rawKJV: And these are the garments which they shall make; «a» breastplate, and an «ephod», and «a» robe, and «a» broidered coat, «a» mitre, and «a» girdle: and they shall make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, and his sons, that he may minister unto me in the priest's office.
grebrew: וְאֵלֶּה הַבְּגָדִים אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשׂוּ חֹשֶׁן וְאֵפוֹד וּמְעִיל וּכְתֹנֶת <H>תַּשְׁבֵּץ</H> מִצְנֶפֶת וְאַבְנֵט וְעָשׂוּ בִגְדֵי־קֹדֶשׁ לְאַהֲרֹן אָחִיךָ וּלְבָנָיו לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִֽי׃

rawKJV: For wherein shall it be known here that I and thy people have found grace in thy sight? is it «not» in that thou goest with us? so shall we be separated, I and thy people, from all the people that are upon the face of the earth.
grebrew: וּבַמֶּה ׀ יִוָּדַע אֵפוֹא כִּֽי־מָצָאתִי חֵן בְּעֵינֶיךָ אֲנִי וְעַמֶּךָ הֲלוֹא בְּלֶכְתְּךָ עִמָּנוּ וְנִפְלֵינוּ אֲנִי וְעַמְּךָ מִכָּל־הָעָם אֲשֶׁר עַל־פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
